Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "Wrong error behavior during upload if blob already exists in storage " (#6840) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody:
Repro steps:
1. Find a package that is not in the DB, but the file exists in `packages` container
2. Try to upload a package with same name

Result:
You get a message: "There is a conflict with the ID and version of your package and another package. Please change your package's ID or version and try again."

This error message is wrong since the situation is a server bug and not "conflict with another id".
We should 500.

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue " problems with push packages to nuget gallery (500 + 409)" (#6833) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody:
Hello. I have self-hosted nuget gallery on IIS and there are some problems with push packages to nuget gallery
On IIS enabled Failed Request Tracing module to cath errors.
I have valid API-key with correct rights for push nuget-packages to nuget gallery/
## Details about problem
To reproduce problem, i generate test package with script:
$id = kalinin-na-test-package
$myversion iterate from 1 to 99.
```
.\new-testpackage.ps1 -Id "$id" -Version "0.0.$myversion" -Title "test" -Description "desc"
```
In result i have 99 `.nupkg` files with id `kalinin-na-test-package`. 
For example `kalinin-na-test-package.0.0.18.nupkg`
Then i push packages from `nuget.exe` or from `nuget publish step in teamcity` (in reality - nuget publish step use nuget.exe too):
$myapikey = 'my-valid-apikey'
```
nuget.exe push .\*.nupkg -apikey $myapikey -Source http://nuget.mysite -Verbosity detailed
```
And in result i have error:
```
Starting: C:\buildAgent\tools\NuGet.CommandLine.4.9.2\tools\NuGet.exe push C:\buildAgent\work\30a63b1383db36e2\kalinin-na-test-package.0.0.1.nupkg ******* -Verbosity detailed -Source http://nuget.mysite
in directory: C:\buildAgent\work\30a63b1383db36e2
NuGet Version: 4.9.2.5706
Pushing kalinin-na-test-package.0.0.1.nupkg to 'http://nuget.mysite'...
  PUT http://nuget.mysite/api/v2/package/
  InternalServerError http://nuget.mysite/api/v2/package/ 186ms
  PUT http://nuget.mysite/api/v2/package/
  Conflict http://nuget.mysite/api/v2/package/ 33ms
Response status code does not indicate success: 409 (A package with ID 'kalinin-na-test-package' and version '0.0.1' already exists and cannot be modified.).
System.Net.Http.HttpRequestException: Response status code does not indicate success: 409 (A package with ID 'kalinin-na-test-package' and version '0.0.1' already exists and cannot be modified.).
   at System.Net.Http.HttpResponseMessage.EnsureSuccessStatusCode()
   at NuGet.Protocol.Core.Types.PackageUpdateResource.<>c.<PushPackageToServer>b__23_0(HttpResponseMessage response)
	   at NuGet.Protocol.HttpSource.<ProcessResponseAsync>d__18`1.MoveNext()
	--- End of stack trace from previous location where exception was thrown ---
	   at System.Runtime.ExceptionServices.ExceptionDispatchInfo.Throw()
	   at System.Runtime.CompilerServices.TaskAwaiter.HandleNonSuccessAndDebuggerNotification(Task task)
	   at NuGet.Protocol.Core.Types.PackageUpdateResource.<PushPackageToServer>d__23.MoveNext()
	--- End of stack trace from previous location where exception was thrown ---
	   at System.Runtime.ExceptionServices.ExceptionDispatchInfo.Throw()
	   at System.Runtime.CompilerServices.TaskAwaiter.HandleNonSuccessAndDebuggerNotification(Task task)
	   at NuGet.Protocol.Core.Types.PackageUpdateResource.<PushPackageCore>d__20.MoveNext()
	--- End of stack trace from previous location where exception was thrown ---
	   at System.Runtime.ExceptionServices.ExceptionDispatchInfo.Throw()
	   at System.Runtime.CompilerServices.TaskAwaiter.HandleNonSuccessAndDebuggerNotification(Task task)
	   at NuGet.Protocol.Core.Types.PackageUpdateResource.<PushPackage>d__19.MoveNext()
	--- End of stack trace from previous location where exception was thrown ---
	   at System.Runtime.ExceptionServices.ExceptionDispatchInfo.Throw()
	   at System.Runtime.CompilerServices.TaskAwaiter.HandleNonSuccessAndDebuggerNotification(Task task)
	   at NuGet.Protocol.Core.Types.PackageUpdateResource.<Push>d__14.MoveNext()
	--- End of stack trace from previous location where exception was thrown ---
       at System.Runtime.ExceptionServices.ExceptionDispatchInfo.Throw()
       at System.Runtime.CompilerServices.TaskAwaiter.HandleNonSuccessAndDebuggerNotification(Task task)
       at NuGet.Commands.PushRunner.<Run>d__0.MoveNext()
    --- End of stack trace from previous location where exception was thrown ---
       at System.Runtime.ExceptionServices.ExceptionDispatchInfo.Throw()
       at System.Runtime.CompilerServices.TaskAwaiter.HandleNonSuccessAndDebuggerNotification(Task task)
       at NuGet.CommandLine.PushCommand.<ExecuteCommandAsync>d__32.MoveNext()
```
### There are two interesting moments:
1. `InternalServerError http://nuget.mysite/api/v2/package/ 186ms`
2. `System.Net.Http.HttpRequestException: Response status code does not indicate success: 409 (A package with ID 'kalinin-na-test-package' and version '0.0.1' already exists and cannot be modified.)` 

### 1st error
About 1st error code (Internal Server Error) (looks like 500, right?) in Failed Request Tracing module in IIS i find report:
```
Warning 
-MODULE_SET_RESPONSE_ERROR_STATUS 
ModuleName
ManagedPipelineHandler 
Notification
EXECUTE_REQUEST_HANDLER 
HttpStatus
500 
HttpReason
The parameter 'to' cannot be an empty string. Parameter name: to 
HttpSubStatus
0 
ErrorCode
The operation completed successfully.
 (0x0) 
ConfigExceptionInfo
 ManagedPipelineHandler 
```
In this case, very interesting `The parameter 'to' cannot be an empty string. Parameter name: to `
What is parameter `to`? I don't know and don't set this parameter whem push my packages.

### 2nd error
About 2nd error code (409):
I check in web nuget gallery and in database and in file storage directory, and yes, package with ID 'kalinin-na-test-package' and version '0.0.1' already exists. But before push i check it to, and this package don't exists anywhere (only on my laptop in local directory).
Question: why nuget.exe try to push package again in gallery? Looks like it think, that Internal Server Error is bad request and try again to push package, but in reality package was pushed to gallery after first attempt.

I completly delete this package from my nuget gallery, and try to push againt from **all clients** dicribed in `NuGet product used` section below, and that behavior repeats again and again.

## NuGet product used
Nuget Gallery
nuget-4.1.0.exe
nuget-4.3.0.exe
nuget-4.4.1.exe
nuget-4.5.1.exe
nuget-4.6.2.exe
nuget-4.7.1.exe
nuget-4.8.1.exe
nuget-4.9.2.exe
Nuget Publish step in Teamcity ( https://confluence.jetbrains.com/display/TCD10/NuGet+Publish )

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Search returns results in no discernable order" (#6835) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody:
I cannot figure out the order in which gallery returns search results. If I search for "FxCop", it's returning old packages that haven't been updated in 4 years and have very little downloads ahead of a package that has over 1 million downloads and was last updated 2 weeks ago.

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1103906/51583193-83f99880-1f23-11e9-8ce4-223a4706e022.png)

Google and Bing both return results I expect:

https://www.google.com.au/search?source=hp&ei=re1HXOCMOcqP9QOHvaXwBA&q=FxCop+site%3Anuget.org&btnK=Google+Search&oq=FxCop+site%3Anuget.org
https://www.bing.com/search?q=FxCop+site%3Anuget.org&qs=n&form=QBLH&sp=-1&pq=fxcop+site%3A&sc=0-11&sk=&cvid=D4C623BA1F304A9C954F019ED3874526

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Support: Account Deletion Requests never marked complete" (#6554) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody:
We have a lot of "Account Deletion Requests" that are not marked complete in the support DB.

On account deletion we set `CreatedBy=NULL`:
https://github.com/NuGet/NuGetGallery/blob/166d4c21134c11f0800aa7e0f0026a53cc583d48/src/NuGetGallery/Areas/Admin/Services/SupportRequestService.cs#L304

In SupportRequestController, we filter where `CreatedBy != NULL`:
https://github.com/NuGet/NuGetGallery/blob/166d4c21134c11f0800aa7e0f0026a53cc583d48/src/NuGetGallery/Areas/Admin/Controllers/SupportRequestController.cs#L234

I believe paging is based on the original count, causing "Next" to always be available.

The correct solution would be to set `IssueStatusId = 3` (completed) when we set `CreatedBy=NULL`, and NOT include that filter. We would also need to update existing data in the DB.

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened pull request "Prettify license endpoint in gallery" (#6839) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody: The license endpoint in gallery should display license expression/file/url/no info for different cases. Page in "~/packages/id/version/license" should support this.

The error is:

This project references NuGet package(s) that are
 missing on this computer. Use NuGet Package Restore to download them.  For more information, see http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=322105. The missing file is ..\packages\Microsoft.CodeDom.Providers.DotNetCompilerPlatform.2.0.0\buil

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Error on build due to missing NuGet packages: "..\packages\Microsoft.Bcl.Build.1.0.21\build\Microsoft.Bcl.Build.targets"" (#7618) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
@wfuller commented on [Fri Dec 07 2018](https://github.com/NuGet/docs.microsoft.com-nuget/issues/1215)

I am getting this error "Error on build due to missing NuGet packages: "..\packages\Microsoft.Bcl.Build.1.0.21\build\Microsoft.Bcl.Build.targets" when I try and build this solution in VS 2013.

Despite the error, I can see the 3 BCL files in my packages.config file:
    <package id="Microsoft.Bcl" version="1.1.3" targetFramework="net45" />
    <package id="Microsoft.Bcl" version="1.1.10" targetFramework="net45" />
    <package id="Microsoft.Bcl.Build" version="1.0.21" targetFramework="net45" />

My package manager settings are set to "Allow NuGet to download missing packages", and to "Automatically check for missing packages during build in Visual Studio".

All of the troubleshooting info I've found suggests this should be all I need. The BCL files are specified in the packages.config file, and so VS should get them from NuGet if they aren't already present. 

But it still isn't working.

I should mention that this is an old web app build on a different computer some time ago by someone else, which I now need to modify. There is an old build that worked and can still run. I just can't get it to build now, on my computer.

Events.RelatedDescription: Reopened issue "'dotnet restore' --source option is not respected when installing msbuild project sdks" (#7589) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
## Details about Problem

dotnet.exe --version: 2.2.100

The --source option to 'dotnet restore' is not respected when installing msbuild project sdks

## Detailed repro steps so we can see the same problem

1. Unzip the attached .zip file ([NetCoreConsoleApp.zip](https://github.com/NuGet/Home/files/2646839/NetCoreConsoleApp.zip)) to somewhere on your machine
2. Run repro.bat

...

Essentially, the .bat calls 'dotnet restore' with an empty directory as the source. The .csproj lists a nuget-based msbuild project sdk. If --source was respected, the sdk would not be installed, yet it is.

Note that --option is respected when restoring PackageReferences, which produce an error as expected

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "dotnet list package outdated should not list RIDs" (#7497) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody: Using the current dotnet CLI 3.0 preview, `dotnet list package --outdated --include-transitive` lists each TFM twice, the second time with some extra transitive runtime packages. It should skip RIDs and only output each TFM once, as it does with the dotnet CLI 2.2.

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Target net47 versus net472 causes "Cannot resolve dependency..." error" (#7590) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
Unknown build error, 'Cannot resolve dependency to assembly 'OtherDll.dll' because it has not been preloaded.   When using the ReflectionOnly APIs, dependent assemblies must be pre-loaded or loaded on demand through the ReflectionOnlyAssemblyResolve event.'

Project configuration:

MyApp.exe - net472
depends on
MyDll.dll - net472
depends on
OtherDll.dll

I am creating a nuget package for MyDll.dll, which depends on OtherDll.dll.  When I add the nuget to MyApp, I expect a reference to OtherDlll to be added.  
The reference is not added if target="lib\net47"
The reference is added if target="lib\net472"


Build command:
NuGet.exe pack MyDll.csproj -Outputdirectory bin\release -properties Configuration=Release





Works:

	<files>
		<file src="bin\$configuration$\*.dll" target="lib\net472" />
	</files>
	
	
Causes the error above:

	<files>
		<file src="bin\$configuration$\*.dll" target="lib\net47" /> 
	</files>
	


NuGet Version: 4.7.1.5393
Runtime Environment:
 OS Name:     Windows
 OS Version:  10.0.17134
 OS Platform: Windows
 RID:         win10-x64
 Base Path:   C:\Program Files\dotnet\sdk\2.2.100-preview3-009430\

Host (useful for support):
  Version: 2.2.0-preview3-27014-02
  Commit:  525082ca3e

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "NuGet: Adding a .NET Standard assembly with RuntimeIdentifier=win will override other TFM assemblies (.NET, Android, iOS, UWP)" (#7661) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
TL;DR: Adding a runtime-specific assembly for .NET Standard overrides other TFM assemblies such as .NET, Android, UWP, iOS, etc...

I made a package with following files:

```
ref\netstandard2.0\Lib1.dll
runtimes\win\lib\netstandard2.0\Lib1.dll
ref\net45\Lib1.dll
lib\net45\Lib1.dll
```

If I compile a `net45` assembly using either no `RuntimeIdentifier` or `RuntimeIdentifier=win7` it will resolve those:

**(A)**
```
Output Item(s): 
    RuntimeCopyLocalItems=
        C:\Users\xen\.nuget\packages\testpackage\1.0.2\lib\net45\Lib1.dll
                NuGetPackageId=testpackage
                NuGetPackageVersion=1.0.2
Output Item(s): 
    ResolvedCompileFileDefinitions=
        C:\Users\xen\.nuget\packages\testpackage\1.0.2\ref\net45\Lib1.dll
                ExternallyResolved=true
                HintPath=C:\Users\xen\.nuget\packages\testpackage\1.0.2\ref\net45\Lib1.dll
                NuGetPackageId=testpackage
                NuGetPackageVersion=1.0.2
                NuGetSourceType=Package
                Private=false
```

However, as soon as I use `RuntimeIdentifier=win`, the `netstandard2.0/win` assembly takes predecence over `net45` one:

**(B)**
```
Output Item(s): 
    RuntimeCopyLocalItems=
        C:\Users\xen\.nuget\packages\testpackage\1.0.2\runtimes\win\lib\netstandard2.0\Lib1.dll
                NuGetPackageId=testpackage
                NuGetPackageVersion=1.0.2
Output Item(s): 
    ResolvedCompileFileDefinitions=
        C:\Users\xen\.nuget\packages\testpackage\1.0.2\ref\net45\Lib1.dll
                ExternallyResolved=true
                HintPath=C:\Users\xen\.nuget\packages\testpackage\1.0.2\ref\net45\Lib1.dll
                NuGetPackageId=testpackage
                NuGetPackageVersion=1.0.2
                NuGetSourceType=Package
                Private=false
```

It is not clear what is the expected priority order:
(1) net45/win, net45, netstandard2.0/win, netstandard2.0?
(2) net45/win, netstandard2.0/win, net45, netstandard2.0?

For me (1) makes more sense. (2) seems pretty bad to deal with additional TFM: adding a `netstandard2.0/win` would override everything since UWP uses `win` and MonoAndroid/iOS either don't have a runtime identifier or use `win`).

Either way, in both cases (1) and (2), it seems there is something not working as expected:

* Case (1): all situations should end up with (A) (right now it doesn't when `RuntimeIdentifier=win`)
* Case (2): it seems something is wrong with RID inheritance being ignored (`RuntimeIdentifier=win7` should end up with (B) rather than (A)).

On top of that I ran into some other discrepencies between `ResolvePackageAssets` and `ResolveNuGetPackageAssets` (esp. when no `RuntimeIdentifier` is set, it ends up finding only ref assemblies without looking into lib folder). I will detail those further once this first part is cleared up.

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "NuGet CLI snupkg pack doesn't include Authors and Owners fields" (#7656) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
**Problem Description**

NuGet packages create with option -Symbols -SymbolPackageFormat snupkg doesn't include Authors and Owners fields in the pacakge. The same command without the symbols option creates the fields as expected.

Here the comparison of the nuspec file included in the 2 packages:

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1030305/50280930-2965ac00-044e-11e9-854d-9bc389add2f4.png)

**Versions**

NuGet version 4.9.2.5706
Windows 10.0.173134 
Visual Studio 2017 v15.9.4

**Repro Steps**

1. Created a new C# Class Library project targeting .NET Framework 4

```
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<Project ToolsVersion="15.0" xmlns="http://schemas.microsoft.com/developer/msbuild/2003">
  <Import Project="$(MSBuildExtensionsPath)\$(MSBuildToolsVersion)\Microsoft.Common.props" Condition="Exists('$(MSBuildExtensionsPath)\$(MSBuildToolsVersion)\Microsoft.Common.props')" />
  <PropertyGroup>
    <Configuration Condition=" '$(Configuration)' == '' ">Debug</Configuration>
    <Platform Condition=" '$(Platform)' == '' ">AnyCPU</Platform>
    <ProjectGuid>88121c56-07d2-4e4b-910e-f4f6189c6adc</ProjectGuid>
    <OutputType>Library</OutputType>
    <AppDesignerFolder>Properties</AppDesignerFolder>
    <RootNamespace>ClassLibrary3</RootNamespace>
    <AssemblyName>ClassLibrary3</AssemblyName>
    <TargetFrameworkVersion>v4.0</TargetFrameworkVersion>
    <FileAlignment>512</FileAlignment>
    <Deterministic>true</Deterministic>
  </PropertyGroup>
  <PropertyGroup Condition=" '$(Configuration)|$(Platform)' == 'Debug|AnyCPU' ">
    <DebugSymbols>true</DebugSymbols>
    <DebugType>full</DebugType>
    <Optimize>false</Optimize>
    <OutputPath>bin\Debug\</OutputPath>
    <DefineConstants>DEBUG;TRACE</DefineConstants>
    <ErrorReport>prompt</ErrorReport>
    <WarningLevel>4</WarningLevel>
  </PropertyGroup>
  <PropertyGroup Condition=" '$(Configuration)|$(Platform)' == 'Release|AnyCPU' ">
    <DebugType>pdbonly</DebugType>
    <Optimize>true</Optimize>
    <OutputPath>bin\Release\</OutputPath>
    <DefineConstants>TRACE</DefineConstants>
    <ErrorReport>prompt</ErrorReport>
    <WarningLevel>4</WarningLevel>
  </PropertyGroup>
  <ItemGroup>
    <Reference Include="System"/>
    
    <Reference Include="System.Core"/>
    <Reference Include="System.Xml.Linq"/>
    <Reference Include="System.Data.DataSetExtensions"/>
    
    
    <Reference Include="Microsoft.CSharp"/>
    
    <Reference Include="System.Data"/>
    
    <Reference Include="System.Xml"/>
  </ItemGroup>
  <ItemGroup>
    <Compile Include="Class1.cs" />
    <Compile Include="Properties\AssemblyInfo.cs" />
  </ItemGroup>
  <Import Project="$(MSBuildToolsPath)\Microsoft.CSharp.targets" />
 </Project>

```

2. Filled required Assembly Information

```
using System.Reflection;
using System.Runtime.CompilerServices;
using System.Runtime.InteropServices;

// General Information about an assembly is controlled through the following
// set of attributes. Change these attribute values to modify the information
// associated with an assembly.
[assembly: AssemblyTitle("ClassLibrary")]
[assembly: AssemblyDescription("NuGet Symbol Package Test")]
[assembly: AssemblyConfiguration("")]
[assembly: AssemblyCompany("ACME")]
[assembly: AssemblyProduct("ClassLibrary")]
[assembly: AssemblyCopyright("Copyright © 2018")]
[assembly: AssemblyTrademark("")]
[assembly: AssemblyCulture("")]

// Setting ComVisible to false makes the types in this assembly not visible
// to COM components.  If you need to access a type in this assembly from
// COM, set the ComVisible attribute to true on that type.
[assembly: ComVisible(false)]

// The following GUID is for the ID of the typelib if this project is exposed to COM
[assembly: Guid("88121c56-07d2-4e4b-910e-f4f6189c6adc")]

// Version information for an assembly consists of the following four values:
//
//      Major Version
//      Minor Version
//      Build Number
//      Revision
//

```

3. Build Project
4. Called nuget pack using the command:

`nuget pack "c:\Temp\ClassLibrary3" -Symbols -SymbolPackageFormat snupkg -Verbosity detailed`

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Setting IsPackable to false disables compilation?" (#7201) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody: After setting `IsPackable` to `false`, there is no output in `bin`. Is this really expected?

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "Deprecate packages on NuGet Gallery" (#33) at NuGet/Announcements
Events.RelatedBody:
The spec for 'Deprecate packages on NuGet Galley' is ready for **review**:

|Spec wiki|Discussion issue|
|----------|------------------|
|[Deprecate packages on NuGet Galley](https://github.com/NuGet/Home/wiki/Deprecate-packages) | https://github.com/nuget/home/issues/2867|

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "'licenseUrl' as package metadata is now deprecated, use 'license' instead" (#32) at NuGet/Announcements
Events.RelatedBody:
As [announced earlier about our aim to remove content Urls (license, icons and markdown documentation) from the package]( https://github.com/NuGet/Announcements/issues/29) and make these metadata part of the package, we have now **deprecated the use of `licenseUrl`** as package metadata. You can now **use `license` field in the nuspec**, instead.

For reference, here are the planned milestones for this feature:
**Milestone 1 (Today)**:
* NuGet.exe v4.9.2 and dotnet.exe (that ships with .NET SDK – 2.1.502 and 2.2.101) supports creating packages using the new “license” property
* Providing “LicenseURL” during pack time is deprecated and a warning is shown if used.
* NuGet.org accepts packages that contain the “license” property, including license files.
* License information (expression or file) is exposed through Package Manager UI in Visual Studio.
* Visual Studio 2017 15.9.4 and above supports surfacing the new “license” property.

**Milestone 2:**
* We will monitor the adoption of clients that can understand the “license” property and NuGet.org will disable the use of licenseUrl when that adoption has reached a threshold.

**Links:**
* Feature announcement: [Packaging Icon, License and Documentation within the nupkg #29](#29)
* Spec wiki: [Packaging License within the nupkg](https://github.com/NuGet/Home/wiki/Packaging-License-within-the-nupkg)
* Discussion issue: [Self-Contained NuGet Packages – License #4628]( https://github.com/NuGet/Home/issues/4628)
